articles.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu suffers the joint heaviest defeat of her career as second seed Iga Swiatek demonstrates her superiority at the Australian Open.
articles.title: Australian Open 2025: Emma Raducanu thrashed by Iga Swiatek in Melbourne

articles.description: The Scotland and Manchester United legend had elegance, charisma and courage. He was a playmaker and a goalscorer, a total footballer, adored by his team-mates and a giant of the game, writes Tom English.
articles.title: Denis Law: The squinting kid who grew into giant of global game

articles.description: American skiing legend Lindsey Vonn explains why she returned to racing after a near six-year absence.
articles.title: Lindsey Vonn: American on skiing comeback which has 'exceeded' her expectations and could lead to Olympics

articles.description: Learner Tien, 19, beats Corentin Moutet while Gael Monfils, 38, defeats fourth seed Taylor Fritz to reach the Australian Open fourth round.
articles.title: Australian Open 2025 results: Learner Tien and Gael Monfils defy generation gaps to reach fourth round

articles.description: Miami Heat forward Jimmy Butler returns from a seven-match ban with 18 points as his side lose to the Denver Nuggets.
articles.title: NBA round-up: Jimmy Butler returns for Miami Heat after seven-match suspension

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on doctor and comedian Ed Patrick with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.
articles.title: Premier League predictions: Chris Sutton v doctor & comedian Ed Patrick

articles.description: Mikel Arteta's Arsenal have been likened to a Jose Mourinho team this season - but how accurate are those comparisons and will it bring success?
articles.title: Arsenal tactics: How Mikel Arteta's Gunners are playing like a Jose Mourinho team

articles.description: Paris St-Germain sign Napoli and Georgia forward Khvicha Kvaratskhelia on a deal until June 2029.
articles.title: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia: Paris St-Germain sign Napoli forward on deal until June 2029

articles.description: Former Scotland, Manchester City and Manchester United striker Denis Law - the only Scottish player to have won the Ballon d'Or award - has died at the age of 84.
articles.title: Denis Law: Manchester United and Scotland legend dies aged 84

articles.description: Crystal Palace complete their first signing of the January transfer window as Millwall winger Romain Esse, 19, joins on a deal until 2030.
articles.title: Crystal Palace: Millwall winger Romain Esse signs on deal until 2030
